column1: question
Do you think crying is a sign of weakness or strength?
Do you know why you feel upset about this, or do you just feel upset?
Do you feel more sad/hurt/angry/worried about that or some other feeling?
On a scale from 1-5, how worried/upset/mad/scared/hurt are you about this? Okay, so how about compared to this other thing?
Do you have unexpected, intense sadness that lasts longer than a few days at a time?
Are you fatigued or lacking in energy?
Do you have feelings of hopelessness?
Have you lost interest in activities you used to enjoy?
Are you losing your temper or fighting more than you used to?
Do you feel worthless or guilty?
What people, situations or events caused you to feel sad or depressed?
What did you do to support your emotional well-being?
What did you do this year that you regret?
What made you cry the hardest this year?
Have you experienced a week or longer of lower-than-usual interest in activities that you usually enjoy?
Have you ever experienced an ‘attack’ of fear, anxiety, or panic?
Do feelings of anxiety or discomfort around others bother you?
Do you feel tired no matter how much you sleep?
Are you experiencing physical symptoms like headaches, insomnia, or digestive issues?
Have your daily patterns shifted in a drastic way?
Have you experienced any kind of change, loss, or trauma recently?
Are you reliant on substances, people, or circumstances to bring you happiness or relief?
Do you feel like there is stability in your life?
Do you feel that you have a person to talk through emotions and feelings with?
